company.name: HireRight Solutions, Inc.
company.business_description: HireRight Solutions is a consumer reporting agency that provides background screening reports to employers containing public record information, including criminal histories, to assist in employment-related hiring and other employment decisions.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a); Sections 13(b) and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 56(a)

complaint.factual_background: HireRight Solutions, a consumer reporting agency providing background screening reports to employers, systematically violated the Fair Credit Reporting Act by failing to ensure accuracy of consumer reports, denying consumers access to their files, not conducting proper reinvestigations of disputed information, and failing to timely notify consumers when public record information was reported. These failures resulted in inaccurate reports being provided to employers, causing prospective employees to be denied employment or employment-related benefits based on erroneous information such as expunged criminal records, duplicate entries for the same offense, and records that belonged to entirely different individuals.

representations_made.description: Implicitly represented that it followed reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of consumer reports
representations_made.quoted_text: Section 607(b) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(b), requires all consumer reporting agencies to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of consumer report information.

representations_made.description: Implicitly represented that it would disclose to consumers all information in their files upon request
representations_made.quoted_text: First, consumer reporting agencies must, upon request, clearly and accurately disclose to a consumer who requests his or her file all information in that file at the time of the request. 15 U.S.C. § 1681g(a).

representations_made.description: Implicitly represented that it would conduct reasonable reinvestigations within thirty days of receiving notice of a consumer dispute
representations_made.quoted_text: Second, within thirty days of receiving a notice that a consumer disputes the completeness or accuracy of information in his or her file, the consumer reporting agency must conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the information from the file. 15 U.S.C. § 1681i(a)(1)(A).

representations_made.description: Implicitly represented that it would provide written notice to consumers of reinvestigation results within five business days
representations_made.quoted_text: Third, the consumer reporting agency must provide written notice to the consumer of the results of the reinvestigation not later than five business days after its completion. 15 U.S.C. § 1681i(a)(6).

representations_made.description: Implicitly represented that it would either notify consumers at the time public record information was reported or maintain strict procedures to ensure such information was complete and up to date
representations_made.quoted_text: These consumer reporting agencies must either (1) notify the consumer, at the time that such information is reported, of the fact that public record information is being reported, or (2) maintain 'strict procedures' designed to ensure the reported public record information is complete and up to date. 15 U.S.C. § 1681k(a).

counts.title: Failure to Ensure Maximum Possible Accuracy
counts.representation: Defendant was required to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of consumer report information
counts.fact: Defendant failed to follow reasonable procedures to assure that information reflected current public record status (such as expungements), failed to prevent duplicate entries for the same criminal offense, and failed to prevent inclusion of obviously erroneous information such as records of other consumers with different names, dates of birth, or other identifiers
counts.conclusion: By and through the acts and practices described in Paragraph 13, Defendant has violated section 607(b) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(b).

counts.title: Failure to Disclose Consumer File Information
counts.representation: Defendant was required to disclose to consumers, upon request, all information maintained in their consumer report files
counts.fact: Defendant either failed to provide consumers with information in their files or failed to do so upon request, with systems resulting in delays or non-fulfillment of requests due to inadequate staffing or technical problems
counts.conclusion: By and through the acts and practices described in Paragraph 16, Defendant has violated section 609(a)(1) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681g(a)(1).

counts.title: Failure to Conduct Reinvestigations
counts.representation: Defendant was required to conduct reinvestigations of the completeness or accuracy of information upon receipt of a notice of dispute from the consumer
counts.fact: Defendant did not conduct reinvestigations of disputed items upon receipt of a notice of dispute, instead requiring consumers to have a copy of the report before initiating reinvestigation, which delayed the process and made it more difficult for consumers
counts.conclusion: By and through the acts and practices described in Paragraph 17, Defendant has violated section 611(a)(1)(A) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681i(a)(1)(A).

counts.title: Failure to Provide Written Notice of Reinvestigation Results
counts.representation: Defendant was required to provide written notice of the results of reinvestigations to consumers
counts.fact: Defendant closed dispute reinvestigations without providing written notice of the results of the reinvestigations to affected consumers
counts.conclusion: By and through the acts and practices described in Paragraph 18, Defendant has violated section 611(a)(6) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681i(a)(6).

counts.title: Failure to Notify Consumers or Maintain Strict Procedures for Public Record Information
counts.representation: Defendant was required to either provide written notice to consumers at the time it reported public record information to employers, or maintain strict procedures to ensure that the public record information was complete and up to date
counts.fact: Defendant neither notified consumers at the time the information was reported (notices were not mailed until after the day the report was transmitted and typically took more than one day to complete), nor maintained strict procedures to ensure that reported public record information was complete and up to date
counts.conclusion: By and through the acts and practices described in Paragraph 20, Defendant has violated section 613(a)(1)-(2) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681k(a)(1)-(2).

definitions.Defendant: HireRight Solutions and its successors and assigns.
definitions.FCRA definitions: The definitions set forth in the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681a, et seq., shall apply.

provisions.title: Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay a $2.6 million civil penalty for FCRA violations within 7 business days of service of the Order.

requirements.description: Pay civil penalty of $2.6 million to the Treasurer of the United States
requirements.quoted_text: Judgment in the amount of2.6 million dollars ($2,600,000) is hereby entered against Defendant as a civil penalty for violations of the FCRA pursuant to section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a). Defendant shall make this payment within seven (7) business days ofthe date of service of this Order to the Treasurer of the United States by electronic fund transfer in accordance with instructions provided by the Consumer Protection Branch, Civil Division, U.S. Department of Justice, Washington, D.C. 20530, for appropriate disposition.

requirements.description: Relinquish all dominion, control, and title to the funds paid
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant relinquishes all dominion, control, and title to the funds paid to the fullest extent permitted by law. Defendant shall make no claim to or demand return of the funds, directly or indirectly, through counselor otherwise.

requirements.description: Agree that facts alleged in Complaint shall be taken as true in subsequent civil litigation
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant agrees that the facts as alleged in the Complaint filed in this action shall be taken as true, without further proof, in any subsequent civil litigation filed by or on behalf of the Commission to enforce its rights to any payment or money judgment pursuant to this Order.

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained and enjoined from violating specific FCRA provisions related to consumer reporting accuracy, disclosure, reinvestigation procedures, notification requirements, and public record reporting.

requirements.description: Must not fail to maintain reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of consumer report information
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendant, and all other persons or entities within the scope of Fed. R. Civ. P. 65, whether acting directly or through any sole proprietorship, partnership, limited liability company, corporation, subsidiary, branch, division, device, or other business entity who receive actual notice of this Order by personal service or otherwise, are hereby permanently restrained and enjoined from: Failing to maintain reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom a consumer report relates, as required by section 607(b) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(b)

requirements.description: Must not fail to follow reasonable procedures to assure information reflects current public record status such as expungement
requirements.quoted_text: failing to follow reasonable procedures to assure that the information contained in consumer reports it furnishes reflects the current public record status of consumers' information, such as expungement of a criminal record;

requirements.description: Must not fail to follow reasonable procedures to prevent multiple entries for the same criminal offense in a manner that would render the report inaccurate
requirements.quoted_text: failing to follow reasonable procedures to prevent the inclusion of multiple entries for the same criminal offense in a single report in a manner that would render the report inaccurate in violation of section 607 (b) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(b);

requirements.description: Must not fail to follow reasonable procedures to prevent provision of obviously erroneous consumer report information such as records of other consumers with different names, dates of birth, or identifiers
requirements.quoted_text: failing to follow reasonable procedures to prevent the provision of obviously erroneous consumer report information to employers, such as purported information on a single consumer that includes records of other consumers with different names, dates of birth, or other identifiers that are available in the public record.

requirements.description: Must not fail to clearly and accurately disclose all information in consumer's file upon request
requirements.quoted_text: Failing to, upon request, clearly and accurately disclose to a consumer all information in the consumer's file at the time ofthe request, as required by section 609(a)(I) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681g(a)(1).

requirements.description: Must not require consumer to obtain copy of consumer report before conducting reinvestigation of disputed information
requirements.quoted_text: Requiring that a consumer who disputes the completeness or accuracy of information in his or her file obtain a copy of his or her consumer report before Defendant will conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the information from the file before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which Defendant receives the notice of dispute from the consumer, in violation of section 611(a)(1)(A) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.c. § 168li(a)(1 )(A).

requirements.description: Must not fail to provide written notice to consumer of results of reinvestigation within 5 business days of completion
requirements.quoted_text: Failing to provide written notice to the consumer of the results of a reinvestigation not later than five business days after its completion, as required by section 611(a)(6) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 168li(a)(6).

requirements.description: Must not fail to notify consumer when public record information is reported to user, or must maintain strict procedures to ensure such information is complete and up to date
requirements.quoted_text: Failing to notify the consumer, at the time such information is reported to the user of the information, of the fact that public record information is being reported by the consumer reporting agency, together with the name and address of the person to whom such information is reported; or, in the alternative, failing to maintain strict procedures to insure that whenever public record information which is likely to have an adverse effect on a consumer's ability to obtain employment is reported it is complete and up to date, as required by section 613(a)(1)-(2) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681k(a)(1)-(2).

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit acknowledgment of receipt of Order and deliver copies to officers, employees, agents, and business entities, obtaining signed acknowledgments within specified timeframes.

requirements.description: Submit acknowledgment of receipt of Order sworn under penalty of perjury
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant, within 7 days of entry of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order sworn under penalty of perjury.

requirements.description: Deliver copy of Order to officers, vice presidents, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives who participate in conduct related to the Order
requirements.quoted_text: For 3 years after entry of this Order, Defendant must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all of its officers, vice presidents, directors, and managers; (2) all of its employees, agents, and representatives who participate in conduct related to the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure as set forth in the Section titled Compliance Reporting. Delivery must occur within 7 days of entry of this Order for current personnel. To all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.

requirements.description: Obtain signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of Order from each individual or entity to which Order was delivered
requirements.quoted_text: From each individual or entity to which Defendant delivered a copy of this Order, Defendant must obtain, within 30 days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit compliance reports to the Commission at specified intervals, including an initial report 180 days after entry and ongoing notices of changes for 5 years.

requirements.description: Submit initial compliance report sworn under penalty of perjury 180 days after entry of Order
requirements.quoted_text: One hundred eighty days after entry ofthis Order, Defendant must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury.

requirements.description: In compliance report, designate contact points, identify businesses, describe activities, describe compliance with each section, and provide copies of Order Acknowledgments
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant must: (a) designate at least one telephone number and an email, physical, and postal address as points of contact, which representatives of the Commission and Plaintiff may use to communicate with Defendant; (b) identify all of Defendant's businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (c ) describe the activities of each business, including the products and services offered, and the means of advertising, marketing, and sales;·· (d) describe in detail whether and how Defendant is in compliance with each Section of this Order; and (e ) provide a copy of each Order Acknowledgment obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Submit compliance notice within 14 days of any change in designated point of contact or structure of Defendant
requirements.quoted_text: For 5 years following entry of this Order, Defendant must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within 14 days of anychange in the following: Defendant must report any change in: (a) any designated point of contact; or (b) the structure of Defendant or any entity that Defendant has any ownership interest in or directly or indirectly controls that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Submit notice of filing of bankruptcy petition or insolvency proceeding within 14 days of filing
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant must submit to the Commission notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or any similar proceeding by or against Defendant within 14 days of its filing.

requirements.description: Ensure all submissions sworn under penalty of perjury are true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746
requirements.quoted_text: Any submission to the Commission required by this Order to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, such as by concluding: "I declare under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States of America that the foregoing is true and correct. Executed on: ____" and supplying the date, signatory's full name, title (if applicable), and signature.

requirements.description: Submit all reports and notices to the Commission via email or overnight courier at specified address
requirements.quoted_text: Unless otherwise directed by a Commission representative in writing, all submissions to the Commission pursuant to this Order must be emailed to DEbrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to: Associate Director for Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW, Washington, DC 20580. The subject line must begin: FTC v. HireRight Solutions, Inc.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant must create and retain specified records for 5 years after entry of Order, including accounting records, personnel records, customer files, complaints, training materials, and compliance documents.

requirements.description: Create and maintain accounting records showing revenues, costs, and net profit or loss for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendant must create certain records for 5 years after entry of the Order, and retain each such record for 5 years. Specifically, Defendant must maintain the following records: Accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold, all costs incurred in generating those revenues, and the resulting net profit or loss;

requirements.description: Create and maintain personnel records for each person providing services for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: Personnel records showing, for each person providing services, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person's: name, addresses, and telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and, if applicable, the reason for termination;

requirements.description: Create and maintain customer files showing names, addresses, telephone numbers, amounts paid, and description of goods or services for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: Customer files showing the names, addresses, telephone numbers, dollar amounts paid, and the quantity and description of goods or services purchased, to the extent such information is obtained in the ordinary course of business;

requirements.description: Create and maintain records of complaints and refund requests and responses for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: Complaints and refund requests, whether received directly or indirectly, such as through a third party, and any response;

requirements.description: Create and maintain copies of all training materials and written policies and procedures related to activities alleged in Complaint or compliance with Order for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: Copies of all training materials and written policies and procedures that relate to Defendant's activities as alleged in the Complaint or Defendant's compliance with the provisions of this Order;

requirements.description: Create and maintain all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of Order for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: All records and documents necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission and Plaintiff are authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through document requests, depositions, discovery, interviews, and posing as consumers or other entities.

requirements.description: Submit additional compliance reports or information, appear for depositions, and produce documents within 14 days of written request from Commission or Plaintiff
requirements.quoted_text: Within 14 days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission or Plaintiff, Defendant must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury; appear for depositions; and produce documents, for inspection and copying. The Commission and Plaintiff are also authorized to obtain discovery, without further leave of court, using any of the procedures prescribed by Federal Rules of Civil Procedure 29,30 (including telephonic depositions), 31, 33, 34,36,45, and 69, provided that, Defendant, after attempting to resolve a dispute without court action and for good cause shown, may file a motion with this Court seeking an order including one or more of the protections set forth in Rule 26 (c).

requirements.description: Permit Commission and Plaintiff representatives to communicate directly with Defendant and interview employees or affiliated persons who agree to interview
requirements.quoted_text: For matters concerning this Order, the Commission and Plaintiff are authorized to communicate directly with Defendant. Defendant must permit representatives of the Commission and Plaintiff to interview any employee or other person affiliated with Defendant who has agreed to such an interview. The person interviewed may have counsel present.

requirements.description: Allow Commission and Plaintiff to use all other lawful means including posing as consumers, suppliers, or other entities without necessity of identification or prior notice
requirements.quoted_text: The Commission and Plaintiff may use all other lawful means, including posing, through its representatives, as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Defendant or any individual or entity affiliated with Defendant, without the necessity of identification or prior notice. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission's lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1.

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.

requirements.description: Court retains jurisdiction for construction, modification, and enforcement of Order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.

provisions.title: Costs and Attorneys' Fees
provisions.summary: Each party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action.

requirements.description: Each party bears its own costs and attorneys' fees
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that each party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action.

duration.termination_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
